program_name: Xcel Energy North Dakota Saver's Switch Program
description: Xcel Energy's Saver's Switch program in North Dakota helps manage peak electricity demand by remotely cycling central air conditioning units and electric water heaters during high-demand periods. The program offers both residential and small business versions. Participants receive monthly credits during the summer season for allowing remote control of their AC units during peak demand events, which typically occur on hot summer days. The program uses a remote switch that cycles AC units on and off for brief 15-20 minute intervals while the fan continues to circulate air. The program operates in the MISO market region serving North Dakota and South Dakota.

service_territories: North Dakota portions of Xcel Energy service territory
Primarily serves portions of eastern North Dakota
geography.critical_geography_note: Xcel Energy's North Dakota and South Dakota service territories are part of the Midcontinent Independent System Operator (MISO) market, not ERCOT or SPP.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Program is available to residential customers and small businesses. Business program is available in Minnesota and Wisconsin with requirements for central air conditioning units of at least 5 tons for Texas and New Mexico territories. North Dakota business eligibility not explicitly confirmed but program materials indicate business customers can participate.

additional_requirements: Must be an Xcel Energy customer in North Dakota
Must have central air conditioning installed (no window units, wall units, or ductless mini-splits)
For renters/apartment/condo residents: property owner consent required
Must provide access to AC unit for professional switch installation
Remote-controlled switch must be installed by authorized licensed electrician at no cost to customer

notice_details.advance_notice_provided: No specific advance notice documented - program operates via automated switch activation
notice_details.notification_to_customer: Most customers 'don't even notice' when system is activated according to program materials. AC units cycle on and off for 15-20 minute intervals with fan continuing to circulate pre-cooled air.

seasonal_rates.notes: Residential and business customers receive $5 per ton of enrolled air conditioning per month during June through September. A typical 3-ton residential AC unit would receive $15/month or $60 for the summer season.

capacity_rate.payment_timing: Monthly bill credits during June through September

performance_rate.notes: No performance-based payment. All compensation is based on enrolled AC tonnage capacity for the summer season.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: No penalties documented for non-performance or override of switch.

payment_caps.notes: Payment based on enrolled AC tonnage. For business customers in Minnesota/Wisconsin, the rate is documented as $5/ton/month from June-September. Assuming similar rates apply in North Dakota (not explicitly confirmed). Typical residential 3-ton unit: $60/summer. Typical commercial 10-ton unit: $200/summer.

seasons.notes: Primary season for AC cycling events. Program is typically activated during times when electricity demand approaches peak levels on hot summer days.

call_windows.notes: Saver's Switch is generally activated during afternoon and early evening hours on high-demand days. AC compressor cycles off for brief 15-20 minute intervals while fan continues circulating air. Average event duration is approximately 4 hours.

cycling_specifications.fan_operation: Fan stays on continuously during cycling to circulate pre-cooled air
cycling_specifications.customer_impact: Most customers don't even notice the system's activation

historical_frequency.notes: Specific historical event frequency for North Dakota not documented in public sources. Program is activated during peak demand periods on hot summer days.

enrollment_period.notes: Rolling enrollment available. Customers can enroll at any time through Xcel Energy website or by contacting customer service. Must commit to one-year participation.

enrollment_process: Complete online enrollment or contact Xcel Energy
Xcel Energy schedules switch installation appointment
Authorized licensed electrician installs remote-controlled switch on AC unit
Customer begins receiving monthly summer bill credits

performance_measurement.notes: This is a traditional direct load control program. Customers receive payment based on enrolled AC tonnage for allowing control, regardless of actual load reduction achieved during events. No individual metering or performance measurement required.

multi_state_participation.program_consistency: Program operates across multiple Xcel Energy service territories with similar structure but state-specific regulatory frameworks and potentially different payment rates

grid_operator_integration.miso_coordination: Xcel Energy coordinates load management with MISO regional transmission organization for North Dakota and South Dakota territories
grid_operator_integration.critical_note: This program operates in MISO territory, not ERCOT. North Dakota and South Dakota are part of MISO market.

program_evolution.change_description: Saver's Switch program originally launched by Xcel Energy (Northern States Power at the time)
Program continues operating with approximately 382,500 residential and 15,500 small business customers enrolled across Upper Midwest territories

program_history.enrollment_note: Approximately 398,000 customers enrolled across all Xcel Energy service territories. Upper Midwest (Minnesota, Wisconsin, North Dakota, South Dakota, Michigan) has approximately 382,500 residential and 15,500 small business participants. North Dakota-specific enrollment numbers not disclosed separately.

program_operations.control_mechanism: Remote-controlled hardware switch installed on AC unit by authorized licensed electrician
program_operations.cycling_method: Automated cycling of AC compressor (brief 15-20 min intervals) while fan continues operating
program_operations.customer_comfort: Program designed to minimize customer discomfort - fan continues circulating pre-cooled air, most customers don't notice activation
program_operations.installation: Professional installation by authorized licensed electrician at no cost to customer
program_operations.aggregate_capacity: Program could reduce electricity demand by approximately 388 megawatts across Upper Midwest territories during peak events

integration_metadata.notes: CRITICAL LIMITATION: This program operates in MISO territory, NOT ERCOT. It cannot be integrated with ERCOT battery optimization strategies. Program is traditional direct load control with hardware switch installation. Limited optimization value due to: (1) non-ERCOT territory, (2) payment structure based on enrolled AC tonnage with no performance measurement, (3) automated switch control with no customer dispatch flexibility, (4) no real-time price signals, (5) residential/small business focus not designed for commercial battery systems.
optimization_considerations: NOT APPLICABLE TO ERCOT BATTERY OPTIMIZATION - Program is in MISO territory serving North Dakota
Traditional direct load control program - not suitable for commercial battery dispatch optimization
No dispatch flexibility - automated switch control only
Payment is flat monthly credit based on AC tonnage, not performance-based
No real-time price signals or market integration
Hardware switch controls load directly - no customer decision-making or bidding
Program designed for traditional residential and small business AC load, not batteries
integration_metadata.ercot_relevance: NONE - This program operates in MISO territory serving North Dakota, completely separate from ERCOT jurisdiction. It has no integration with ERCOT markets, ERCOT demand response programs, or ERCOT price signals.
integration_metadata.battery_applicability: Not applicable. This is a traditional residential and small business direct load control program for AC units with hardware switch installation. It does not support behind-the-meter battery participation and provides no economic optimization opportunities for battery storage systems. Payments are based on enrolled AC tonnage capacity, not on actual dispatch or performance of energy storage resources.

clarifications.miso_not_ercot: CRITICAL: Xcel Energy's North Dakota service territory operates in the Midcontinent Independent System Operator (MISO) regional transmission organization, NOT in ERCOT. This means the program has NO integration with ERCOT markets, ERCOT demand response programs, or ERCOT operational mechanisms.
clarifications.residential_and_business: Unlike some jurisdictions where Saver's Switch is residential-only, the program in the Upper Midwest region (including North Dakota) is available to both residential customers and small businesses. Business enrollment page explicitly lists North Dakota as eligible state.
clarifications.payment_structure: This is a capacity payment program based on enrolled AC tonnage. Customers receive monthly credits during June-September for allowing control. Minnesota/Wisconsin business rate is documented as $5/ton/month. Residential program materials mention 15% discount or $5/ton but specific North Dakota residential rate not clearly stated.
clarifications.hardware_requirement: Unlike modern smart thermostat programs, this program requires physical installation of a remote-controlled switch by authorized licensed electricians. This is traditional direct load control technology.
clarifications.customer_experience: Program marketing emphasizes that 'most customers don't even notice' when the switch is activated because the fan continues running and cycling occurs in brief 15-20 minute intervals.
clarifications.multi_state_program: Saver's Switch operates across multiple Xcel Energy service territories. Total enrollment across all states is approximately 398,000 customers with Upper Midwest (Minnesota, Wisconsin, North Dakota, South Dakota, Michigan) having approximately 382,500 residential and 15,500 small business participants.
clarifications.aggregate_capacity: The program could reduce electricity demand by approximately 388 megawatts across Upper Midwest territories during peak demand events.

research_notes.confidence_note: High confidence in program availability and general structure. Medium confidence in specific payment rates and requirements for North Dakota due to limited state-specific documentation. Payment rate of $5/ton/month assumed based on Minnesota/Wisconsin business program but not explicitly confirmed for North Dakota.
research_notes.critical_limitation_for_ercot_battery_op: THIS PROGRAM IS NOT RELEVANT FOR ERCOT BATTERY OPTIMIZATION. It operates in MISO territory (North Dakota), not ERCOT territory. It is a traditional direct load control program for residential and small business AC units with capacity-based payments, not a market-based demand response program suitable for commercial battery storage optimization. The program has no integration with ERCOT markets, prices, or operational systems.
